com.gwtplatform.dispatch.server.actionhandler

Interface ActionHandler<A extends Action<R>,R extends Result>

  • Type Parameters:
    A - The type of the action extending Action.
    R - The type of the result extending Result.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractActionHandler, BatchActionHandler
    Deprecated. 
    Please use ActionHandler.

    @Deprecated
public interface ActionHandler<A extends Action<R>,R extends Result>
    Instances of this interface will handle specific types of Action classes.

    Important! Your action handlers must be thread safe since they will be bound as singletons. For details, see http://code.google.com/p/google-guice/wiki/Scopes#Scopes_and_Concurrency.

    Author:
    David Peterson

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        R execute(A action,
        ExecutionContext context)
                         throws ActionException
        Deprecated. 
        Handles the specified action. If you want to build a compound action that can rollback automatically upon failure, call ExecutionContext.execute(com.gwtplatform.dispatch.shared.Action). See here for details.
        Parameters:
        action - The action.
        context - The ExecutionContext.
        Returns:
        The Result.
        Throws:
        ActionException - if there is a problem performing the specified action.

      • getActionType

        Class<A> getActionType()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        The type of Action supported by this handler.

      • undo

        void undo(A action,
        R result,
        ExecutionContext context)
          throws ActionException
        Deprecated. 
        Undoes the specified action. If you want to build a compound action that can rollback automatically upon failure, call ExecutionContext.undo(com.gwtplatform.dispatch.shared.Action, com.gwtplatform.dispatch.shared.Result). See here for details.
        Parameters:
        action - The action.
        result - The result of the action.
        context - The ExecutionContext.
        Throws:
        ActionException - if there is a problem performing the specified action.
